channel.title: Iptables
channel.description:
Hey guys Im having a problem with Iptables on my Fedora 13. I was juss wondering if anyone here could help me out on it thanks. Here are the subnets/ip addresses that i am using. Ive also added the scenario that im having trouble with aswell Thanks for the help in advance [b]Router[/b] 18.0.64.1 255.255.248.0
145.165.16.1 255.255.254.0
192.168.10.1 255.255.255.0
[b]Client[/b] 145.165.16.2 255.255.254.0
[b]Client2[/b] 192.168.10.2 255.255.255.0
[b]Server[/b] 18.0.64.2 255.255.248.0
Scenario 1: Block all web traffic to the IIS server from Host 1 Block all ssh traffic to the router from Host 2 Block Ping from Host 1 to all other interfaces including the default gateway
Scenario 2: Block all FTP traffic to the Windows Server from Host 1 Allow Host 2 to Ping the default gateway but not the Windows Server gateway or the Windows Server itself Block web traffic to the Apache Server from Host 1 and 2 Block traffic to the MYSQL server from Host 1

item.title: Iptables
item.dc:creator: @darkilla darkilla

never mind guys i got it lol thanks tho

item.title: Iptables
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

probably not the best person to give advice but for most of that couldn’t you use the hosts.deny and hosts.allow?

Read full topic

item.title: Iptables
item.dc:creator: @darkilla darkilla
item.description:
@darkilla wrote:

Hey guys Im having a problem with Iptables on my Fedora 13. I was juss wondering if anyone here could help me out on it thanks. Here are the subnets/ip addresses that i am using. Ive also added the scenario that im having trouble with aswell
Thanks for the help in advance
Router
18.0.64.1
255.255.248.0

145.165.16.1
255.255.254.0

192.168.10.1
255.255.255.0

Client
145.165.16.2
255.255.254.0

Client2
192.168.10.2
255.255.255.0

Server
18.0.64.2
255.255.248.0

Scenario 1:
Block all web traffic to the IIS server from Host 1
Block all ssh traffic to the router from Host 2
Block Ping from Host 1 to all other interfaces including the default gateway

Scenario 2:
Block all FTP traffic to the Windows Server from Host 1
Allow Host 2 to Ping the default gateway but not the Windows Server gateway or the Windows Server itself
Block web traffic to the Apache Server from Host 1 and 2
Block traffic to the MYSQL server from Host 1
